str2: Or, than. A primary particle of distinction between two connected terms; disjunctive, or; comparative, than.
One. (including the neuter Hen); a primary numeral; one.

parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Genitive Feminine Singular
Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
str2: To cry aloud, shriek. A primary verb; properly, to 'croak' or scream, i.e. to call aloud.

parse: Verb - Perfect Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: A prolonged form of a primary stao stah'-o; to stand, used in various applications.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative Masculine 3rd Person Plural
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
From the base of peran; properly, through, i.e. Around; figuratively with respect to; used in various applications, of place, cause or time.
A rising again, resurrection. From anistemi; a standing up again, i.e. a resurrection from death (its author), or a recovery.
(a) adj: dead, lifeless, subject to death, mortal, (b) noun: a dead body, a corpse. From an apparently primary nekus; dead.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Nominative 1st Person Singular
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Middle or Passive - 1st Person Singular
str2: Properly, to distinguish, i.e. Decide; by implication, to try, condemn, punish.
On, to, against, on the basis of, at.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
Today, now. Neuter of a presumed compound of the article ho and hemera; on the day; generally, now.
